p: Furthermore, olfactory neuropathy has reported as a rare form of typical peripheral neuropathy induced by SARS-CoV. When dealing with cases of ECoV physicians must asses the CN I critically, it is mandatory for the physician to exclude possibilities of olfactory bulb trauma from history taking, olfactory glioma, frontal lobe meningioma, a lesion in the sub frontal region, nasal cavities and paranasal sinuses by MRI. Moreover, neurodegenerative disorders, and Parkinsonâ€™s disease, which typically affect CN 1 before cognitive and motor manifestations, never the less clinical judgment and otolaryngological consultation are necessitated as anosmia is much more frequently due to the common cold and local causes in the nasal cavity [67], [68].
